text: New England is a region in the Northeastern United States consisting of six states: Maine, Vermont, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Connecticut, and Rhode Island. The name was coined in 1616 by the English explorer John Smith. Image:Connecticut State Capitol in Hartford.jpg|Connecticut Image:L.L. Bean Hunting and Fishing Store, Freeport ME.jpg|Maine Image:Worcester Memorial Auditorium, MA.jpg|Massachusetts Image:Pumpkin_Fest,_Main_Street,_Keene_NH.jpg|New Hampshire Image:Rosedale_Apartments,_Cranston_RI.jpg|Rhode Island Image:Main Street, Montpelier VT.jpg|Vermont
title: New England
